publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1128 Mr Adam Ingram: National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004-That the Parliament recognises that one in five people will suffer from depression at some point in their lives and considers that National Depression Week will highlight the problem; notes the sharp increase in prescription of medication for depression with little or no psychological support and the continued use of the anti-depressant Prozac for those under 18; considers this to be an intolerable situation, and calls for the support and resources required to enable a holistic approach to treating depression to be put in place as a matter of urgency.
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Stewart Stevenson*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Christine Grahame*

S2M-1128 Mr Adam Ingram: National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004-That the Parliament recognises that one in five people will suffer from depression at some point in their lives and considers that National Depression Week will highlight the problem; notes the sharp increase in prescription of medication for depression with little or no psychological support and the continued use of the anti-depressant Prozac for those under 18; considers this to be an intolerable situation, and calls for the support and resources required to enable a holistic approach to treating depression to be put in place as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Mary Scanlon*, Murray Tosh*, Robert Brown*

S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Brian Adam*, Patrick Harvie*, Fergus Ewing*, Robin Harper*, Kate Maclean*, Mr David Davidson*, Bruce Crawford*, David Mundell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Rob Gibson*
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) John Swinburne*, Shona Robison*
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1128 National Depression Week, 19 to 25 April 2004 (lodged on 30 March 2004) Donald Gorrie*
